subject: Re: The Ghost Box, is training required?
author: ourobouros2k2
full_text:
Perhaps I should qualify my statement a little more. In much the same
way that Bill Chappelle has his anti-liability warnings on his
products, I made the above statement because from the moment I started
my fledgeling attempts at communication, tertiary paranormal activity
increased in my apartment by a factor of 10. Thankfully, it didn't
stay, and I now use a protection ritual, but these were lessons
learned the hard way. I have had a few negative entitied, and
thankfully they were relegated to single curing phrases and were very
short lived. I am grateful I am of made of sterner stuff than the
activity that I am positive was a form of intimidation to attempt to
dissuade me from using a box.

My 'not for the faint of heart' comment was directed at those people
who aren't well balanced and dealing with these type of 'side effects'
of box communication might cause issues or rock belief systems. I
firmly believe that a person should be prepared for these types of
thing, and even if it doesn't happen to everyone, it is always a
possibility.

I fully agree that some are drawn to box research and some are not. On
a personal level, ITC in general is my primary focus of communication
attempts. I have definately been hooked, lol

thanks,
Andy
